bibl.title: Teachers in the Eastern Roman Empire (Fifth-Seventh Centuries). A Historical Study and Prosopography.

series.title: The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume VIII

bibl.note: Introduction. - First stages of education. - Teacher of grammar - γραμματικός. - Teacher of rhetoric - σοφιστής and ῥήτωρ. - Teacher of philosophy - φιλόσοφος. - Teacher of medicine - ἰατροσοφιστής. - Teacher of law - ἀντεκήνσωρ. - Prosopography of teachers [1-320]. - Geographical and chronological list of teachers. - Pp. 330-333: Egypt.

bibl.title: Alexandria. Auditoria of Kom el-Dikka and Late Antique Education

bibl.seg: SZABAT Elzbieta, Teachers in the Eastern Roman Empire (Fifth-Seventh Centuries). A Historical Study and Prosopography.

Tomasz DERDA, Tomasz MARKIEWICZ and Ewa WIPSZYCKA (Edd.), Alexandria. Auditoria of Kom el-Dikka and Late Antique Education = The Journal of Juristic Papyrology. Supplements. Volume VIII (Warsaw, 2007) pp. 177-345.

Introduction. - First stages of education. - Teacher of grammar - γραμματικός. - Teacher of rhetoric - σοφιστής and ῥήτωρ. - Teacher of philosophy - φιλόσοφος. - Teacher of medicine - ἰατροσοφιστής. - Teacher of law - ἀντεκήνσωρ. - Prosopography of teachers [1-320]. - Geographical and chronological list of teachers. - Pp. 330-333: Egypt.
